title: On the Beach launches on the job developer training
text:
On the Beach launches on the job developer training 29 July 2015 Save 
On the Beach is launching a new programme allowing developers to train while being paid a salary this September, writes Abbi Murray . 
The Ruby Academy is a six-month course starting with a five-week of in-class training where they will learn many skills including behaviour-driven development and object-oriented design. 
After completion, senior developers from the OTA will advise and guide the budding developers on supplying unique experiences for existing On the Beach customers. 
Those taking part will be working with several Ruby experts, as well as having their own Ruby Coach. 
Upon graduating, the former students join numerous development teams of accomplished Ruby developers. 
Upon completion of the course, applicants can work at On the Beach which expects to handle one million customers in 2015. 
Chief technology officer Jonathon Smith said: “The passion and talent of our people is what drives the business forward and we invest heavily in our team. 
“I am really excited by and very much looking forward to seeing what our next group of Ruby Academy students brings to our team and also to see them grow and develop with our business”.
